document.masterDocTitle: Geometridae (Lepidoptera) of the Baikal region: keys to species and an annotated catalogue. Part 1. Ennominae

Distribution. Siberian-Far Eastern, boreomontane. Middle Ural, Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug , Altai Mountain, Irkutskaya Oblast, Buryatia , Transbaikalia, Yakutia, Chukotka , Magadanskaya Oblast, southern part of Khabarovsky Kray, Primorye. Outside Russia : N Mongolia .

Note. The subgenus
Dysgnophos Wehrli, 1951
is currently represented by two species in the Baikal region:
Ch. ( D. ) subsplendidaria ( Wehrli, 1922 )
and
Ch. ( D. ) turfosaria ( Wehrli, 1922 ) ( Beljaev & Mironov 2019 )
. I studied about 50 specimens of
Dysgnophos
from different locations in Irkutskaya Oblast and Republic of Buryatia . Male genitalia were revealed to be rather variable in this sample, and some variants of this variability have been considered to be diagnostic at the species level by some authors (e.g. Wehrli 1922 ; Smiles 1979). Thus, Siberian
Dysgnophos
show different degree of sclerotization of the U-shaped cornutus (see Fig 17J–17O ), and inconstant number of spines on the costa of the valva has been found even within the same sample: from 0 to 2. The size and coloration of the adults are also markedly variable. Beljaev (2016) doubted the species rank of
Ch. ( D. ) subsplendidaria
. However, I found a female with some genital characters different from typical to
Ch . ( D .) turfosaria
that could suggest separate species. The
Ch . ( D .) turfosaria
species-group requires a revision based on more abundant materials.
